facts.short_summary: Driver cited for speeding in active construction zone. Speed was 55 mph in posted 35 mph work zone. Double fine applies.
facts.detailed_facts: On August 5, 2022, at 11:30, the driver was travelling through an active construction zone on the New York State Thruway. The posted speed limit was 35 mph due to active construction, and the driver was clocked at 55 mph using radar. Workers were present in the zone. The driver has one previous speeding ticket from 2021. Weather was clear, good visibility. Driver holds a New York Class D licence.
aggravating_factors: 20 mph over limit in work zone
defence_issues_spotted: Verification that work zone was properly marked
Confirmation that workers were actually present at time of violation

advice_variants.short_label: Seek reduction to avoid double fine
advice_variants.full_advice_text: Work zone violations in New York carry double fines, which can be significant. Given your one prior violation and the circumstances, you may be able to negotiate a reduction. Request disclosure to verify that the work zone was properly marked and that workers were actually present at the time of your violation. If the work zone requirements weren't fully met, you may have grounds for a reduction. Even if the work zone was properly established, your clean record (aside from one prior) may help in negotiations. Consider requesting a plea to a non-work-zone speeding violation to avoid the double fine. This is general information only and not legal advice; you should speak with a licensed attorney about your exact circumstances.
key_reasons: Work zone requirements must be strictly met
One prior violation is not severe
Double fine is a significant penalty to avoid

advice_variants.short_label: Review work zone compliance, then decide
advice_variants.full_advice_text: Work zone violations require that the zone be properly marked and that workers be present. Request full disclosure including photos of the work zone signage, documentation of worker presence, and the officer's notes. If the work zone wasn't properly established according to New York requirements, you may have a defence. However, if the work zone was properly set up and workers were present, the evidence will be strong. Review the disclosure carefully with a legal professional to determine whether negotiation or trial is the better approach. This is general information only and not legal advice; you should speak with a licensed attorney about your exact circumstances.
likely_benefits: Potential defence if work zone improperly marked
Better negotiation position with disclosure review
